main event: A possible aircraft sighting was reported by a civilian observer in Santa Maria, California on January 6, 1957.
interesting points: The object was described as having a contradictory shape, being both cigar-shaped and round.
The object appeared orange in color with a bluish extension, and did not seem to have wings or a tail.
The object was estimated to be faster than a jet aircraft and at an altitude of 15,000 feet.
The object was initially observed moving from northeast to south, before fading out.
The observation lasted for about 23 seconds and was made using binoculars.
sighted object: a possible aircraft or unidentified aerial object
witnesses: a civilian observer, a 17-year-old student who was a member of the Ground Observer Corps
photographs: no photographs were present in the report
